newsitem.title: USA: RESEARCH ALERT - Prudential starts 3 tech stocks.
newsitem.headline: RESEARCH ALERT - Prudential starts 3 tech stocks.

text.p: -- Prudential started coverage of U.S. Internet access provider Performance Systems International Inc, Australian Internet access provider OzEmail Ltd and software graphic technology developer Fractal Design Corp, giving each a buy rating, a Prudential source said.
-- Later, analyst Lisa Thompson confirmed that she had started the three stocks as buys.

-- In addition, Thompson, who recently joined Prudential from Unterberg Harris, said she also started America Online Inc, CompuServe Corp, Netcom On-Line Communications Inc, Caere Corp, and Quarterdeck Corp, all with neutral ratings.

-- Thompson said she estimated Performance Systems, also known as PSINet, will record a loss of $1.06 per share in 1996, a loss of $0.15 in 1997 and a profit of $1.15 per share in 1998. She set a 12-month target price of $50 on PSI.
-- She estimated OzEmail would earn $0.12 per share in 1996 and $0.50 in 1997. She has a $15 price target on the stock.

-- The Prudential analyst said she expected Fractal to earn $0.46 per share in the current fiscal year ending March 1997 and $0.60 price per share during fiscal 1998. She put a target price of $18 on Fractal.
